abstract.p: Corrections of June 27 article on decoding of human genetic code; photo caption, diagram and chart explained (S)

block.p: A front-page caption yesterday about the decoding of the human genetic code by two teams of scientists reversed the names of the teams' leaders in some copies. Francis S. Collins, head of the Human Genome Project, was on the left; J. Craig Venter, head of Celera Genomics, was on the right.

The front-page diagram with the article on the decoding reversed the twist of the double helix of DNA. The strand rising from lower left to upper right should be beneath the strand falling from upper left to lower right.
A chart with the continuation of the article misstated the pairing of the bases that make up DNA. Adenine pairs with thymine; guanine pairs with cytosine.
